title: Christian Benteke pens new one-year contract extension at Crystal Palace
text:
Christian Benteke has been handed a one-year contract extension at Crystal Palace, keeping him at the club until at least the end of the 2020/21 season.

The former Liverpool man has committed his immediate future to the club, despite failing to rediscover his goalscoring touch since moving to Selhurst Park.

Palace parted with £27million to sign the Belgian from Liverpool in August 2016, after Jurgen Klopp deemed the player surplus to requirements at Anfield.

Striker Christian Benteke has been handed a one-year contract extension at Crystal Palace

So far Benteke has endured a time marred by injuries in south London, making only 19 Premier League appearances during the previous campaign.

The Belgian has 21 Palace goals to his name so far.

Upon the confirmation of the new deal, Benteke said: 'I am very happy to have reached an agreement to extend my contract with Palace for another year.

'I am more committed than ever to repaying the faith that the chairman, manager and our amazing fans have shown in me.'

Palace signed Benteke for £27m in 2016 after Jurgen Klopp ruled him out of his future plans

Palace have also handed a contract extension to James Tomkins until the end of 2021/22

Palace have also handed a contract extension to defender James Tomkins with a slightly longer time-frame, keeping him in south London until the end of the 2021/22 season.

Tomkins has played 87 times for Palace since his move to Selhurst Park from West Ham in the summer of 2016.

He is currently sidelined with a groin injury but is close to returning for Roy Hodgson's side.

Tomkins said: 'I'm now in my fourth season and I've really enjoyed my time at Palace. I'm excited about the future here and didn't hesitate to commit myself to the club for an additional two years.'
description: Christian Benteke has been handed a one-year contract extension at Crystal Palace, keeping him at the club until at least the end of the 2020/21 season.
